content.description:
on the far right side of the formation there is a tan/golden face with a left facing crack with a flake at the top.  Immediately past this is a horizontal crack followed by a delicate face move past a single bolt to a bolt anchor on black granite.

Getting onto the face at the top is the crux.

It is possible to reach the anchors at the top by scrambling around the back side and making easy 5th class moves onto the summit block from the rear.
content.protection: .5, .75, 2x#2, 2x#3, a draw for the bolt on the face, and draws for an offset bolt anchor.
content.location: The far right side of the formation.  scamper around the last block,  and belay from below the slab.  the first 20 feet are easy 4th class to get to the base of the crack.

content.description:
This route goes through the big gold face that you can see from the road. A little bit of everything: Start with a tricky slab, pull up a nice crack, then into a short, but difficult crux. Take a nice rest on a ledge, then finish up some easier climbing to the anchors. From the ledge, make sure you head to the right to the horizontal crack and the straight up through the bush (which always seems to grow back).

Slab and crux are bolted.
content.protection: Blue TCU to gold Camalot, quickdraws, chain anchors. Make sure you save a good selection of cams for the top. Bring some double length slings to reduce rope drag at the ledge.
content.location:
Cross the creek and head to the left side of the crag. The obvious line headed up the biggest face. Climb up a short 4th class step to access the start.

Make sure you bring a 70 m rope to get down. 60 will come up short.
